summary: Website for a tailor offering stitching services (blouse, ghagra, dress, one-piece, etc.) named "The Golden Needle".

existing_features.title: Create a responsive marketing website for a tailor business named “The Golden Needle”, with clear navigation and content focused on stitching services such as blouse, ghagra, dress, and one-piece garments.

Add a Home page layout with the following sections: hero (headline + short description), Services (list of stitching services including blouse, ghagra, dress, one-piece), Process/How it works (simple steps), and a Contact section with a basic inquiry form (name, phone/email, message).

Add a Gallery/Work page (or section) that displays a small set of sample tailoring images in a clean grid with captions (e.g., “Blouse”, “Ghagra”, “Dress”, “One-piece”). Use locally hosted static assets for the images.
Create a coherent, distinctive visual theme for “The Golden Needle” and apply it consistently across pages (colors, typography, spacing, buttons, cards). Do not use a blue/purple-dominant palette.

Add basic SEO/accessibility setup: set document title to “The Golden Needle”, include a short meta description, ensure proper heading structure (single H1 per page/primary view), and ensure keyboard focus styles are visible.
Add the generated image assets to the repository under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the header/hero and gallery as appropriate.

Add a new page section titled "Trending Blouse Patterns" that showcases a curated set of trending blouse pattern ideas in a clean responsive grid (image + pattern name + 1–2 sentence description) and uses an in-page anchor id (e.g., "blouse-patterns") for navigation.
Update the site header navigation to include a link/button that smoothly scrolls to the new "Trending Blouse Patterns" section.
Add new locally hosted static image assets for the trending blouse patterns under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the new section (do not fetch images from the backend).

Update ONLY the selected Phone text element in the Contact section (XPath: /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/section[6]/div[1]/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/p[1]) to display the two phone numbers "8050453168" and "8792063888" in English, and make them click-to-call links (tel:8050453168 and tel:8792063888) while keeping the existing styling consistent (use the same Tailwind text-muted-foreground styling).

Update the Contact section "Location" address text in `frontend/src/components/sections/ContactSection.tsx` to display the business address in English as: "Someshwar Complex, near Karnataka Bank, CBT, Hubli 20" (replace the current placeholder address lines).

Update `frontend/src/components/sections/GallerySection.tsx` to support a large gallery collection (intended to scale to thousands of items) by rendering gallery items from a single, easily extendable in-code data structure and displaying them with incremental loading (e.g., pagination or a “Load more” interaction) to avoid rendering the entire dataset at once.

Add simple gallery filtering controls in `frontend/src/components/sections/GallerySection.tsx` so visitors can quickly browse categories such as “Blouse”, “Ghagra”, and “Other” (for additional garment types). Filtering must work together with the incremental loading behavior.

Add a substantially larger set of locally hosted gallery image assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated` (new fashion blouses, ghagra, and additional stitched garments) and update the gallery dataset to use these new images along with meaningful English titles and `alt` text.

Update the website’s Instagram social link in the footer to point to the business Instagram account: https://www.instagram.com/the_goolden_needal?igsh=MWxoN2YwbHVvZXJnZQ==. Replace the current placeholder href in `frontend/src/components/SiteFooter.tsx` and ensure the link opens in a new tab with appropriate security attributes.

Update the Contact section email contact shown in `frontend/src/components/sections/ContactSection.tsx` (currently displayed as "info@goldenneedle.com") to display the business email ID exactly as: "thegoldenneedle07".
